result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gavin James Ziegler

records.addlTxt:
1:57 PM Defendant Gavin James Ziegler in court.  Attorney Chad LaLor State of Wisconsin in court. 
Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Defendant's address confirmed. Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties.  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Not guilty plea(s) entered. 
Court informs defendant about the waiver of attorney form/speaking with district attorneys office.
State requesting $500sb No contact with Walmart.  
Not showing any priors for the defendant.
Court orders $500 sb No contact with Walmart.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
